text: William Lee Ball (January 2, 1781 - February 29, 1824) was a nineteenth- century politician from Virginia. ==Biography== Born in Lancaster County, Virginia, Ball received a liberal schooling as a child. He was a member of the Virginia House of Delegates from 1805 to 1806 and again from 1810 to 1814. He served as a paymaster in the War of 1812 and was assigned to the 92nd Virginia Regiment.Marquis Who's Who, Inc. Who Was Who in American History, the Military. Chicago: Marquis Who's Who, 1975. P. 26 He later went on to serve in the Virginia State Senate from 1814 to 1817. He was elected a Democratic- Republican and later a Crawford Republican to the United States House of Representatives in 1816, serving from 1817 until his death in Washington D.C. on February 29, 1824.
